sentences.english: According to Xie Wanglin's best-selling novel, based on the reality.
sentences.chinese: 根据谢旺霖同名畅销小说改编，真人真事为蓝本。

sentences.english: The novel go since a ture story.
sentences.chinese: 这小说取材于一个真事的历史。

sentences.english: It looks like reality TV shows are here to stay.
sentences.chinese: 看来真人真事的电视节目已成为风潮。

sentences.english: Should people read only those books that deal with real matters?
sentences.chinese: 人们应该只读那些描写真人真事的书籍吗？

sentences.english: He said I must have been quite a kid.
What he only shout is absolutely true.
sentences.chinese: 他刚才说的完全是真事的。

sentences.english: The film am writing acres a ture man.
sentences.chinese: 影片描写的是一个真事的人。

sentences.english: Television news reporters are broadcasting stories of resurrections and miracle healings.
sentences.chinese: 电视新闻在报导死人复活及神迹医治等真人真事。

sentences.english: That's a real story of a real person, happening these days in Russia.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个近几天在俄罗斯发生的真人真事。

sentences.english: However, in my experience, the most extraordinary stories are often the true ones.
sentences.chinese: 然而根据我的经历，最奇怪的故事往往是真事。

sentences.english: The only true wisdom is in understanding you understand nothing.
sentences.chinese: 一个真事的智慧是清楚你一无所知。

sentences.english: This play is with different true story.
All the characters in the book are recordn since ture life.
sentences.chinese: 书中所有的人物都来自于真事的生存。

sentences.english: When you watch the movies, you feel it is really happening.
sentences.chinese: 看电影的时候，你会觉得电影里发生的是真事。

definition: item of storytelling or performed dialogue (folk arts)/sketch
to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
